pros:
Nice faculty and staff.
Shared governance - employees have a voice
Administration is working to move the university forward
Fun events and employee appreciation
cons: Some supervisor attitudes hurt morale. Low pay for hourly workers. Death by meetings...progress is slow. Students need to be the central focus. High burnout - add more staff for the heavy workload in some departments.

review_title: The work is dominated by undergrad courses averaging 30 students. Research is talked but minimized.
pros: The work focuses on teaching a variety of platforms--traditional, hybrid and online--and requires moderate committee participation. Accreditation gets  emphasis. The LMS is available for all courses.
cons: The environment is politically charged, the management is simplistic, and the traditions supplant needed progress. The self governance committee activity is highly suspect.

pros: Great for working with you school schedule. Allows you to take off work if you need to concentrate on school.
cons: Didn't get paid as well as you could if you would go elsewhere for the same work. I know that his isn't the departments fault it is the schools.

pros: The school environment is upbeat and diverse. Small college feel on campus. A place where you aren't just a number. Office tries to connect employees through various events.
cons: Limited budget and resources. Occasional unprofessional staff, but you can find that anywhere. Limited upward career mobility. Work life balance good in summer months with three day weekends.

pros: Close-knit staff, many team building functions and luncheons.  Casual Fridays and spirit wear encouraged.  Relaxed environment
cons: Small budget, and can be cheap about things like coffee and pens.  Some staff members gossipy and unprofessional.  Zero personal growth opportunities in my position and not much opportunity for upward mobility.

pros: There are many great people that work at the University.  Collaborating with different departments is a great part of the job.
cons: Walking across campus can be unfortunate, if it is raining or too hot out.  Otherwise, it is a great place to work.
